FEATURE TALK: Value Investing: Applying Graham and Buffett by Raimondas Lencevicius

The talk will cover two different but related value investing approaches.

First, we will discuss Buffett's approach of earnings based value investing or buying superior companies cheap. In this part, we will look at what makes a superior company (moat, return on equity) and what makes it cheap (future cash flows).

In second part, we will cover Graham asset-based value investing or buying dollar for half-dollar. Here we will look into how to value company based on its underlying assets: cash, inventories, capital equipment, etc.

We will finish with some strategy questions, such as purchase and sale timing.

Raimondas Lencevicius has been investing for about twelve years with a focus on Buffettology and net-net value investing in last eight. He holds Ph.D. in Computer Science and works as a researcher at Nokia Research Center in Cambridge. He is a member of our group and is interested in more discussion in our group of value investing.



Tom Bulkowski, the technician and author, has given us a free copy of his book "Getting Started in Chart Patterns" to raffle off at this meeting. Here's the Amazon.com page for this book: http://www.amazon.com...

Market Talk led by Doug Roberts

Doug has delivered his Market Talk ever since we moved to MIT. The banter in our group of bulls versus bears has become vigorous as the market alternately rallies and tumbles. Join this discussion as Doug gives his perspective on fundamentals, technicals and sentiment. Doug is one of the leaders of the group and is a full-time trader.
